p: Anxiety and anger are two emotions commonly expressed in times of uncertainty. MERS patients and those thought to have come in contact with MERS patients isolated for an average of two weeks. During isolation, 47.2% of MERS patients reported symptoms of anxiety, and 19.4% reported these symptoms persisted 4 to 6Â months later [ 21]. This represents the lasting effects that experience anxiety can have on people during isolation.
